summary: Richard C. Wrase is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) based on payroll certifications from October and November 1977, and May 1978. The documents list his name, position, and salary during these periods. The specific role or responsibilities of Richard C. Wrase within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Richard C. Wrase's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While his specific role is not detailed, his presence on the payroll signifies his involvement in the committee's work during the specified period.
